intro: Hymenodictyon scabrum, commonly known as the rough hymenodictyon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and rough, hairy leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and ecological research.
